intro: Linum flavum var. linearifolium, commonly known as the slender flax, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It features slender, linear leaves that are typically less than 2 inches in width, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy yellow flowers with a distinctive dark center, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its fibrous stems and leaves have been historically used for textile and medicinal purposes.
